title: >>> Took Long ENOUGH
body_text:
Continued Success
Lenny Herrera vs. Steve Adams was one of the more controversial matches in recent history, and perhaps of all-time. Even though Steve left mid-way during the event, his team stayed strong, piling on win after win towards events end. "Luck" is perhaps the best word to describe Lenny's second win as captain as the match ended 5 to 4 via mutual agreement.
Steve's captains record after this loss is now at 1 and 4. Lenny however improved to 2 and 0.
Who is the next challenger? Find out this Saturday at DODGEBALL XLIV.
Superstardom
A returning Guy Ritt put on a performance much like he did his debut night at DODGEBALL XXVIII. Unquestionably one of the most powerful throwers, that skill alone showed that is a true danger to any opponents. He certainly struck up what could be an intense rivalry with the one and only John Tronolone.
The legend of Tom Adams continues to grow with each passing event. In one game, he singled-handedly eliminated all but one of his opponents. The rest of his enemies hit the sidelines.
A Return in the Making
For the second time in two weeks, another serious injury was at hand (no pun intended).
Veteran Dan Spengeman, who just came off winning the event's poster contest, suffered the same fate as one Chris Burke did some two weeks back. Dan, who is known for his incredible blocking skills, misstimed a ball thrown by the powerful Zach Katz. As the ball came crashing into Dan's ball, it also struck his left pinky finger, dislocating and fracturing it instantly.
As of June 14th, Dan had successful surgery to repair the shattered finger. He is certainly wished a speedy recovery.
In order to keep him in the dodgeball scene, Dan is now in full control of all promotional posters. Starting with DODGEBALL 45, all posters will be created by him.
The Facts
> Attendance: 23
> New Players: (2) Tina and Joe L.
> Biggest Returns:
Chi So (Last played at DODGEBALL XXVIII)
Guy Ritt (Last played at DODGEBALL XXVIII)
> Captains for the event were reigning champ Lenny Herrera against then 1 and 3 icon, Steve Adams. Lenny would go on to defeat Steve in a close match-up, 5-4.
> For the first time in history, the tennis courts of Ocean Road Park were used. The first game was played on the basketball courts but as time wore on, the entire park itself had become empty. It was at that time the action shifted to the tennis courts which certainly had a different feel. Upon the arrival of tennis players, the action moved back to the basketball courts.
> Similiarly to last week's DODGEBALL 42, not a single dodge ball was lost despite the event being held at ORP.
> DODGEBALL 43 Poster Contest Results:
#1 ... 44% (Created by Dan Spengeman)
#5 ... 32% (Created by John Tronolone)
#6 ... 16% (Created by Justin Pierce)
#4 ... 8% (Created by Diana DiBuccio)
#2 ... 0% (Created by Diana DiBuccio)
#3 ... 0% (Created by Diana DiBuccio and John Tronolone)
DODGEBALL XLIV
It's time to move once again from the original home of dodgeball to the second and apparently more popular home known as Wall High School. XLIV will start at the normal time of 6:30.
A Quick Message
"I apologize for the lack of updates and previews this past week. It has been a tiresome week for me as both jobs, a WWE show, and trying to order future WWE tickets have kept me busy. I will try to get back on track as I have always enjoyed updating, despite few readers.
On a final note, the future WWE tickets I am talking about are for WrestleMania 23: Thank God for travel packages ... Johnny will be in Detroit next April.
Get the story:
http://wwecoowner.livejournal.com/
."
Schedule
DODGEBALL XLIV
Saturday, June 17th, 2006
Wall High School at 6:30pm
DODGEBALL 45
Saturday, June 24th, 2006
Wall High School at 6:30pm
DODGEBALL 46
Friday, June 30th, 2006
Wall High School at 6:30pm
DODGEBALL 47
Friday, July 7th, 2006
Wall High School at 6:30pm
